title: Online Portfolio Service
content:
I’m looking for an online portfolio service to upload my work to.

My sister uses this site [http://www.carbonmade.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075007/http:/www.carbonmade.com/ "http://www.carbonmade.com/") but I’d like to know if there are other sites out there as well (preferably free or for a low fee).

An ideal site would allow me to upload high quality images (with little to no limit on file size or amount), support PDF, JPEG, GIF and PNG files, and have a section to list information about each project image. A place for contact information and resume uploading would be good too.

Anything like that out there?

If you use the service, could you give me a review and remark if you like it or not.

Thanks.

comments.content:
[Behance](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075007/http:/www.behance.net/) and/or [design:related](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075007/http:/www.designrelated.com/) may be worth considering. _(Some more: [Coroflot](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075007/http:/www.coroflot.com/), [Computerlove](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075007/http:/www.cpluv.com/).)_

_(But you may as well consider hosting the files/site/whatever yourself.)_

Dav

<cite>(But you may as well consider hosting the files/site/whatever yourself.)</cite>

In an ideal world, I would. But I’m not very adept at web developing and have to get something online ASAP so I can start hunting for a job. I figured an online portfolio service would meet my immediate needs to get something up and quickly.

I’ve been interested in Behance, they have a nice site... I’ll look into that definitely!

If you need an invitation for Behance let me know. _(Just send me a message via Typophile and I’ll send you one / invite you.)_

Dav
Got it, they’re accepting new invites now. I started playing around with the portfolio which seems pretty advanced.
